actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide an income tax deduction for the performance by an individual of volunteer services for a Federal, State, or local governmental agency.

summary.text: Volunteers' Tax Incentive Act - Provides an income tax deduction for the performance by an individual of volunteer services in fields having particular importance to the welfare of the community, including services for police departments, rescue squads, and hospitals. Provides that the amount of such deduction shall be the number of hours contributed to such service multiplied by two dollars. Limits the tax deduction to $2,000 in any taxable year.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide an income tax deduction for the performance by an individual of volunteer services for a Federal, State, or local governmental agency.
